intro: Scrophularia paniculata, commonly known as purple toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, two-lipped flowers that range in color from pale purple to deep violet, often with a distinctive yellow throat. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a common sight in meadows and woodland edges. Scrophularia paniculata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
